title: Cheryl goes for gold in plunging dress at Attitude Awards
text:
Is there any outfit she can’t wear? (Picture: Rex/Getty)

Cheryl dared to bare on the red carpet on Wednesday night as she enjoyed a rare night off from parenting duties to attend the Attitude Awards at Camden’s Roundhouse.

Showing her support for the LGBTQ+ community at the event hosted by the UK’s best-selling gay magazine, the 36-year-old showed off her phenomenal figure (can we just remind everyone she had a baby a mere two years ago?) in a gold plunging mini dress that highlighted her tiny, rarely seen cleavage tattoo.

The frock’s intricate design featured thousands of gold sequins in vertical stripes, with an added velvet buckle detailing around the neck that tied in her thigh-high black boots.

If anyone can rock a look like this, it’s gotta be Cheryl.

Wearing her light coloured hair in loose waves, our Chez paired her look with gold eye makeup, a nude lip and stunning peachy coloured blush we’re determined to replicate at home.

The star was joined by a number of stars from the LGBTQ+ community and their allies, including Taron Egerton, Joan Collins and rising star Ava Max.

We’re loving the light hair! (Photo by Joe Maher/Getty Images)

The boys are back (Picture: David M. Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images)

With the stunning Sam Smith (Picture: Richard Young/REX)

Freddie and Rachael Flintoff and the lovely ladies from Virgin Atlantic (Picture: David M. Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images)

However, we have to say our eyes were particularly drawn to former Attitude cover stars McFly, with the recently reformed boyband looking insanely dapper in their formal wear.

With music provided by DJ extraordinaire Jodie Harsh, drag was present throughout the event, with 19-year-old RuPaul’s Drag Race UK star Scaredy Cat appearing with his girlfriend Pussy Cat, while Freddie Flintoff made a beeline for the Virgin Atlantic drag queen crew.

Maybe someone should tell him they’re not actual flight attendants…
